meanings.definition: Defeated in a physical fight or battle.
meanings.sent1: The exhausted soldier felt defeated and outfought after the intense battle.
meanings.sent2: The team was clearly outfought by their opponents on the field.
meanings.sent3: Despite their best efforts, they were outfought by the enemy in the final showdown.
meanings.sent4: The underdog's determination was no match for the outfought champion.
meanings.sent5: The image of the defeated knight stood as a testament to being outfought in combat.

meanings.definition: To have fought better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outfought her opponent with skillful tactics in the boxing match.
meanings.sent2: The experienced general outfought the enemy forces in a strategic battle.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully argued over who outfought the other in their imaginary duel.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed allowed him to outfought all obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete's dedication and hard work helped him outfought his competitors in the race.
